topics.body:
Eh; for shits and giggles I felt like taking a IQ test.  I can see why they're useless for judging intelligence now.  When you get down to it they're more of judge of what the tester deems "intelligent" rather than a unbiased set of testing standards.

*edit before you ask it I got 155

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5599b1b663687254ce0008dc#post_5599b1b663687254ce0008dc
[bq="QuasarNova"]"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5599b0f0636872127700003f#post_5599b0f0636872127700003f

Is there even a way of really testing intelligence?

I know there's one for common sense, but you can be a moron and have common sense.[/bq]
Accurately?  No.

It's why so many people that can join MENSA don't.  Joining mensa is more of a ego stroking.  *For the most* part mensa from what I've seen is filled with people that aren't all that smart, but scored high on the tests to get in to stroke their egos.


If you get into mensa the people that during meetings that don't hang out with anyone and look annoyed like "why the fuck did I join this place?" tend to be the smarter people.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5599b2f963687235bc000d3e#post_5599b2f963687235bc000d3e
Pretty much.

Honestly the way I view intelligence is that you can tell who is smarter of the bunch by how poorly they can talk.  When it comes to intelligence for the most part once you reach a certain point it gets hard to talk to people in normal conversations and explain it in everyday terminology.

It's why popular scientists aren't all that good because for every Neil Degrasse Tyson there's someone behind him rolling his eyes.


Not to sound egotistical, but as a child they thought there was something wrong with me cause I couldn't speak well cause I could get answers to the questions easy and that but whenever I tried to talk I tried push all that information out all at once and it would sound like "eyrupnoone" cause your brain works so much faster than your mouth so while it doesn't sound like a problem, but if you try to shove out all of your thoughts at once it doesn't make sense when it leaves your mouth.


Don't ever try to talk to savants, cause they're so intelligent that most of them don't know how to talk or communicate anymore.  To everyday people they seem "stupid", but if you can actually understand them you realize they're not actually "stupid" they're just so smart they don't know how to function.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5599b4f863687273bb0014a7#post_5599b4f863687273bb0014a7

"@Whatevs":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5599b44b6368723f97001c6a#post_5599b44b6368723f97001c6a

You're just describing one aspect of intelligence there.

If you want to get pretty specific, intelligence is pretty much a chart with RPG skills.

You'll develop some areas both because it's easier, but also because the way our behavior is shaped due to external sources means that some skills will get sacrificed in favors of others, so someone who is great at calculus at the expense of social interaction is not necessarily smarter or dumber when compared to someone who is bad at math but has people skills honed to sell ice to a penguin. Savvy?
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4
